Material used.Description: Human 293T and mouse Flp-InNIH3T3 cells were cultured in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium with 10% calf serum.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I formed homodimers (HA-DJ-1 co-precipitated with FLAG-M26I) and heterodimers with endogenous DJ-1 (weaker band compared to wild-type but detectable).
R98Q showed robust homodimerization (HA-DJ-1 co-precipitated) and heterodimerization with endogenous DJ-1, similar to wild-type.
D149A formed homodimers and heterodimers, with comparable band intensity to wild-type.
L166P failed to form homodimers (no HA-DJ-1 co-precipitation) but formed heterodimers with endogenous DJ-1 (significantly reduced band intensity vs. wild-type).
C106S was not explicitly tested in co-IP assays (focus on PD-associated mutants).
C46S (non-dimerizing control) showed no homodimerization, used as negative reference in yeast two-hybrid but not in mammalian co-IP.

Basic positive control.Description: FLAG-DJ-1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-specific IgG was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Similar band intensity compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced band intensity or no band compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Material used.Description: Saccharomyces cerevisiae L40 cells were cotransformed with pGLex-DJ-1 and various mutant constructs fused with the GAL4 activation domain.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I formed heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1 and homodimers (β-galactosidase activity positive), indicating normal interaction capability.
R98Q showed positive β-galactosidase activity with wild-type DJ-1 and self-interaction (homodimer), consistent with normal dimer formation.
D149A formed heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1 and homodimers, as indicated by positive β-galactosidase activity.
L166P failed to form homodimers (β-galactosidase activity negative with self-prey) but formed heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1, confirming specific homodimerization defect.
C106S was tested but not explicitly mentioned in yeast assay results (focus on PD-associated mutants).
C46S (non-dimerizing control) showed no homodimerization, used as negative reference.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 interaction was used as a positive control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Growth on selective media indicates interaction.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Lack of growth on selective media indicates no interaction.

Material used.Description: NIH3T3 cell lines were cultured in a 96-well plate and treated with various amounts of hydrogen peroxide for 12 or 24 h.

Readout description.Result Description: M26I cells showed significantly reduced viability (p < 0.01) compared to wild-type at both H_2O_2 concentrations, with survival rates ~50-60% of wild-type.
R98Q cells exhibited moderate viability reduction (p < 0.05) compared to wild-type, with survival rates ~70-80% of wild-type at 750 μM H_2O_2.
D149A cells showed viability comparable to wild-type (p > 0.05), with survival rates >90% of wild-type under both conditions.
L166P cells had drastically reduced viability (p < 0.001), with survival rates <20% of wild-type, similar to DJ-1 knockdown cells (D2).
C106S was not tested in this assay (not mentioned in the document).
C46S was not tested in this assay (not mentioned in the document).

Biological replicates.Description: More than five experiments were carried out.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells expressing wild-type DJ-1 were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Parental NIH3T3 cells were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability similar to or higher than wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly reduced cell viability compared to wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells.

Material used.Description: Mouse NIH3T3 cell lines stably expressing FLAG-tagged wild-type DJ-1 or its mutants (M26I, R98Q, D149A, L166P, C106S) were used. For endogenous ROS detection, cells were treated with 5 μM DCFH-DA for 30 min. For exogenous H_2O_2 challenge, cells were first treated with 100 μM H_2O_2 for 60 min, then with DCFH-DA for 30 min. Parental NIH3T3 cells and DJ-1 knockdown cells (D2) were included as controls.

Readout description.Result Description: In endogenous ROS assay, M26I cells showed higher fluorescence intensity (reduced ROS scavenging) compared to wild-type. In exogenous H_2O_2 assay, fluorescence shift indicated impaired H_2O_2 elimination.
Both endogenous and exogenous assays showed increased fluorescence in R98Q cells, indicating reduced ROS/H₂O₂ clearance compared to wild-type.
D149A cells exhibited elevated fluorescence under exogenous H_2O_2 treatment, though less severe than L166P/C106S. Endogenous ROS levels were near-normal.
L166P cells showed drastically increased fluorescence in both assays, comparable to DJ-1 knockdown cells (D2), indicating complete failure in ROS/H₂O₂ elimination.
C106S cells displayed fluorescence profiles identical to L166P and D2 cells, confirming丧失 (loss of) ROS-scavenging activity.
C46S was not tested in this assay (not mentioned in the document).

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in triplicate, and representative data are shown (implied by standard flow cytometry protocols).

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in duplicate on the flow cytometer.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1-expressing cells showed low fluorescence (effective ROS clearance) in both assays.

Basic negative control.Description: Parental NIH3T3 cells (no exogenous DJ-1) and DJ-1 knockdown cells (D2) showed high fluorescence under H_2O_2 challenge.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity ≤ wild-type mean + 1 SD (endogenous) or ≤ wild-type mean + 2 SD (exogenous H_2O_2)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fluorescence intensity > wild-type mean + 2 SD (endogenous) or > wild-type mean + 3 SD (exogenous H_2O_2)

Approved assay.Description: DCFH-DA flow cytometry is a validated method for ROS detection (cited in , ).
